phrases: Ladies and gentlemen, good evening.
There are men who sniff around the mystery that surrounds myself and my friend.
Little by little, their search brings them closer to our secret.
Hear me, young man and young lady.
Hear me, noble souls acting in unison.
Be on your guard,
Count!
You miserable brat!
Die!
Act 14: Lost Souls
You sons of...
Count!
Are you all right?!
You need not worry about me.
But...
Why is this happening to me?!
Has not my record always been perfect?!
You should know that!
Right?
I have always been above reproach, with no blemish on my record!
Albert!
This is all your fault!
It is all because you brought that accursed Count to Paris!
What lies did you fill his head with?!
Tell me!
Mark my words!
Do not get cocky!
You will be next!
Disaster will come calling at your house, too!
Give it a rest!
Hey, let go of me!
Do you have any idea who I am?!
Let go!
Get your hands off me!
Count!
You should go home now.
Let us meet again some other time.
Are you really okay?
This are not good...
Hey, Ali!
Do your thing.
Your abilities are as impressive as ever...
Albert!
This is all your fault!
You will be next!
Disaster will come calling at your house, too!
Yoo-hoo!
You have been in there for ages.
Did something happen?
No, I am fine.
What is it?
Maximilien is here to see you.
Maximilien!
Monsieur Albert.
You are looking well!
It is good to see you again.
Why the sudden return to Paris?
I have come here to fetch Monsieur Noirtier.
I thought that he should be at Valentine's side.
I guess you are right.
I came here expecting to have another quarrel with Monsieur Villefort,
It came as quite a shock to hear what had become of him.
Yeah...
I wanted to come pay you a visit and express my gratitude.
Thank you for all you have done for us.
Still as upright and formal as ever, huh?
It was because you were there for me...
If nothing else, please do not forget that one thing.
Maximilien...
I am glad that I met you.
Take good care of Valentine.
I will.
See you around, Maximilien.
Thanks to you, my stocks have hit the trading limit for several days in a row.
These various tidbits of information find their way to me, that is all.
I do not really ask for them.
Oh, how I envy you...
It is a waste of one's life to tie one's happiness to the fluctuations of numbers.
More importantly, though...
Dramatic Arrest of Crown Prosecutor Villefort in Public Spectacle.
This is most shocking, is not it?
Yes, it is...
One never can tell what will happen next in life.
By the way, Baron, what is this I hear about you and the Crown Prosecutor being old friends?
Not at all, not at all!
We are just acquaintances, we are not what you would call friends.
Oh, is that true?
You, General Morcerf, and the Crown Prosecutor here are old friends,
I have heard stories along those lines, so I was curious.
T-That must be a rumor spread by jealous people, no doubt.
Well, if you say so.
Still, people can be brought low by the most unexpected things.
I suggest that you exercise the utmost caution in the company you choose to keep, Baron.
Baron?
Yes?
I am quite serious about your daughter.
I would like to receive your blessing as soon as possible.
What a mess...
I am sorry to keep you waiting.
My name is Beauchamp.
Y-You are a reporter?
Yeah.
Then this is your lucky day!
You are going to have a scoop that is going to be splashed across the front page!
What do you want in return?
How much will your company pay for a big scoop?
I am really busy, so if you will excuse me...
W-Wait!
I am talkin' about a huge scandal involving General Morcerf!
This is going to knock even YOUR socks off.
Hey, sorry to bother you.
Why did you need to see me so suddenly?
Well, we are doing a special feature on General Morcerf's presidential bid.
I figured I should use my personal connections, so I was hoping to ask you a few questions.
Sure, if it is something I can answer.
Thanks.
By the way, why do you think your father has managed to achieve such success?
I would like to hear your frank opinion as one of the people closest to him.
Well, let me think...
I guess it would be his sincerity.
My father loves and worries about the country in the same way that he loves my mother deeply.
Have you heard about how my father became a hero...
After he returned to Paris, he used that as a springboard and shot up through the ranks,
And now he is making a bid for the presidency, huh?
Yes.
My father's enthusiasm for politics is the real deal.
I see...
I am rooting for your father, too.
It is times like these when a man makes a lot of enemies.
You should watch your back, too.
Did something happen?
Nah, it is nothing serious.
But when you deal in gossip like you do in my line of work, you get all kinds of crazy tips.
Tales of bribery, kickbacks, illicit affairs...
You get sick of it.
That is hilarious!
My father is not involved with any of that stuff.
Frankly, I am more worried that he might be a little too straight-laced to be a politician.
You do not say...
I would be relieved if he ever did something like that.
He is a lot more shrewd than I gave him credit for.
Yeah, I guess you are right.
Sorry to worry you over nothing.
The fact of the matter is, a fishy guy paid me a visit today.
He was this creepy, sleazy old man.
What did he say his name was?
Caderousse, or something like that.
What did he...
What did that man say about my father?
Oh, some stupid story.
Something about how the stories of your father's exploits at Janina are all a lie.
I told him he was full of crap and chased him away.
Oh...
Open flames are strictly prohibited in this building.
Please extinguish your lighter immediately.
Smoking is prohibited in this room.
Please smoke only in designated areas.
I guess I would better look into this...
Step right up!
Pay our establishment a visit tonight, my good gentlemen!
The dead man has come back to us!
Edmond would never forget what we did, not in a million years.
Something about how the stories of your father's exploits at Janina are all a lie.
Disaster will come calling at your house, too!
No, that is not possible.
It could not be.
Thank you for agreeing to speak with us.
First of all, Marquis Cavalcanti,
What was it that made you decide on that particular bank?
I leave all investment matters to my advisory analysts.
I abide by their decisions and follow their advice.
That is the only reason.
There are also rumors that you have been seeing Baron Danglars' daughter.
Oh, are there?
I realize that it is a personal question, but if you would care to make a comment...
All right, just a brief one, then.
The fact is, Eugenie de Danglars and I were formally engaged this morning.
My goodness!
It is like a fairy tale!
Is that true?
Congratulations on your engagement!
This is big news, everyone!
He has to be lying...
Idiot.
If I would known you were here, I would have been able to play even better.
I would have been playing for you.
Yes.
Naturally, she is overjoyed about this, too.
Step right up!
Watch it!
Eugenie...
Please, I have to speak with Eugenie.
Let me see her.
Mademoiselle has said that she does not wish to speak with you.
I want to see her in person and ask her how she feels about this.
Please, I am begging you!
I am sorry, Monsieur.
Please!
At least tell her that I am here!
Eugenie!
Was someone at the door just now?
No, Mademoiselle.
Just a deliveryman.
Oh.
What are all these flowers for?
What is the meaning of this?!
How could you arrange an engagement for me without asking me about it?!
I told you that your happiness is my main concern, did not I?
But I AM the one who is going to have to marry him!
You are still young.
It is too soon for you to make important decisions on your own.
Do you really mean what you are saying, Father?
Of course I do.
I wish you would stop doing this!
Where are you going?
I invited Marquis Cavalcanti to dinner tonight.
Do not be late!
If you are looking for Albert, he is out right now.
Out where?
Beats me.
Oh.
Albert...
Ow!
I did not throw mine that hard!
You bastard!
Jerk!
Now you are going to get it!
It is all over between me and Eugenie.
I hear that she got engaged to Cavalcanti.
Yeah...
This is not what Eugenie wants.
There is something behind it.
Come on, you know Eugenie would never voluntarily get engaged to a guy like that.
I am not so sure...
I do not know anymore.
I cannot tell what is true, and what is a lie.
I just do not know anymore.
Albert...
Franz... I am still me, are not I?
Whatever happens, I will still be...
Please, Franz, tell me!
I will not change, right?!
No matter what happens, I am still going to be me, right?!
Death is certain, its hour uncertain, huh?
Talk about a sinister expression...
Albert.
As far as I am concerned, I think I would rather know the truth.
Even if learning the truth changed who I am.
Franz...
I am thinking of leaving Paris for a while.
You are going back to Luna or something?
That is a good idea!
At a time like this, a trip is the best thing to...
I am sorry, but I cannot take you with me.
Why the hell not?!
What is the big idea?!
I am sorry.
You, too, huh?
Now I get it.
We have all grown up.
We are supposed to keep secrets from each other.
You and I should call it quits, too, Franz.
I mean, a secret hideout?
What are we, kids?
Albert...
Wait for me, Albert.
Trust me, I will get to the truth.
Albert!
Count?
You were not hurt!
Yes, I am right as rain.
Is something the matter?
You are out without an umbrella.
Oh, I thought that getting soaked for a change would not be such a bad thing.
So I see.
That reminds me, I am on my way to go off into space again.
What do you say?
Would you care to join me?
Um...
Today is not a good time.
Oh, I see.
I am sorry.
Oh, there is no need to apologize.
I hope that you will accept my offer some other time, then.
I cannot bring myself to leave you here; not with that look on your face.
Come, let us go together.
We waited for you, but dinner has ended.
I was out looking for Albert.
I see that there is still room in your heart for no one but him.
Monsieur Albert has gone off into deep space.
Apparently, he is going to spend time with the Count at his summer retreat.
Oh...
He is?
Oh, that is right.
There is been a steady stream of flowers to congratulate you.
This one is from me.
Why?
Why do these things keep happening to me?
Why do you suppose that is?
Count, I am afraid...
What is the truth?
What is a lie?
That is something that you must decide for yourself.
Do you have the resolve to overcome your limitations and press ever onward?
You will be all right.
Count...
The first public speech by presidential race forerunner General Fernand de Morcerf...
Numerous public figures have also rushed here to show their support,
General Morcerf, it is time.
Please take your place on the stage, sir.
I only made it this far because I had you at my side.
I am so proud of you.
Get the car ready!
I am going to the National Assembly!
Away from the worlds of men, I find myself alone with the Count.
But there is no escaping from the truth.
Act 15: The End of Happiness, The Beginning of Truth
Bide your time, and hold out hope!
